title: Zoey Deutch reveals her 'anxiety and nerves' are pushing her in a 'positive direction'
text:
Zoey Deutch has revealed she believes her past struggles with anxiety are no longer holding her back and are now 'driving and pushing' her forward.

The actress looked nothing short of sensational as she posed in a stunning photoshoot for the latest issue of Rollacoaster magazine where she discussed her career.

The Politician star, 24, admitted to the publication that she has spent much of her life feeling anxious or 'out of control'.

Interview: Zoey Deutch, 24, has revealed she believes her past struggles with anxiety are no longer holding her back and are now 'driving and pushing' her forward

She said: 'I'm certainly trying to pay attention to setting a course of action for my life and having control over my life which I think has been huge for me.

'I spent so much of my life feeling anxious or out of control or scared, and now I feel like those things feel more like a superpower than kryptonite for me right now.

'It feels like my anxiety and my nerves and my fears are driving me and pushing my ambition in a positive direction, rather than holding me back.'

Zoey currently stars as Infinity Jackson in The Politician on Netflix and also has a role in the newly released Zombieland: Double Tap opposite Woody Harrelson and Emma Stone.

She said: 'I'm certainly trying to pay attention to setting a course of action for my life and having control over my life which I think has been huge for me'

The actress further opened up about dealing with anxiety in a recent interview with Cosmopolitan magazine.

'I came into this world with anxiety,' she said. 'I used to hold my breath from anxiety when I was a baby and it would make me faint.'

'There are times when it's debilitating, and there are times when it makes me laugh, like in the car today when I lost the plot entirely,' she said. 'But I actually feel like my superpower is my anxiety.

Zoey added: 'It feels like my anxiety and my nerves and my fears are driving me and pushing my ambition in a positive direction, rather than holding me back'

Career: Zoey currently stars as Infinity Jackson in The Politician on Netflix and also has a role in the newly released Zombieland: Double Tap opposite Woody Harrelson and Emma Stone

'It's one of my key motivators, and it's at the center of my ambition.'

In her photoshoot for Rollacoaster, Zoey stunned in a variety of different looks including one where she donned a blue negligee with a lace hemline.

In another look, the film star wore a black blazer-style dress and added height to her frame with black heels with fluffy straps.

The latest issue of Rollacoaster magazine is on sale now.
description: The Politician star, 24, admitted to the publication that she has spent much of her life feeling anxious or 'out of control'.
